column7:
An average Indian domestic route traveler isn't spoilt for choices, rather accustomed to selecting least bad from the worst.

While we all know, Tata pioneered the air travel in India, later to be nationalised by the then Government just to abuse the premium travel sector in the name of Air India, and today, the legacy Tata air had set is wiped off by more lathargic than ever, Air India. But it's not just the national carrier to be blamed par se, the full carrier premium airlines like Jet airways compete in incompetence overall too.

Having said all this, and starved of choices, the shiny new Vistara is quite a respite. It brings in the Tata value that we are all pampered with, you will know what I mean if you're a Taj Hotels baby.

Vistara not only has the newest boings and airbus, it's cleaner and visually appealing interiors (cooled enough) are extremely welcoming.

Staff, both, on ground and in the air take good care of you no matter how cranky you are about anything.

Needless to say food served by Taj catering is fresh, warm and homely.

Net net, worth taking a flight when traveling in India!

This airline really stands out in terms of the facility, food and services they provide and once you fly with them, you may never ever want to fly with carriers like AI.

However, number of flights and cities in which they operate are limited and hence not always you can get their service, even if you are ready to spend some extra money.

Vistara really met our needs for our holiday to Kerala, because all their service is top quality while still competing with the domestic Indian low cost airlines. They fly domestic services from the new T2 terminal in Mumbai airport which suited my wife and I having flown in from London and Bahrain respectively. Very few of my Indian colleagues at work had heard of this new airline, but I felt confident that the partnership between Singapore Airlines and Tata would be a winner and it most certainly is.

column6: Terrible cancelled two flights and did not inform us and say takes 10 days before refund can be given
column7:
Absolutely abysmal customer service.

They cancelled two flights for which we had business class tickets described on them as "Confirmed and Guaranteed". After we had booked they cancelled both flights and failed to tell us. It was only by complete chance that I noticed the day before we were to leave England that these flights were not on their schedule checker any more.

I rang their call centre in India and was told that both flights had been cancelled. I asked how they had informed us and they said by text. When I said no such text had been received despite them having the correct number on the booking he suggested it might be because it was a UK mobile phone number. No email confirmation of cancellation had been received despite them having correct email address.

Despite having cancelled both flights they had kept the money I had paid them.

I obviously asked for the full refund and they said that it would take ten days before this could be enacted because it was an international credit card. Interestingly there was no such delay when paying for the tickets.

Astoundingly bad service which could have completely ruined my trip if I had not noticed problem by chance.

See in service industry first impression is last impression.

2. The second spoiler was dinner. I already had disgusting experience in premier plaza lounge. When food was served i asked for veg. It was not up the mark. I just had to satisfy myself with curd.

I hope they read my feedback and improve.

column7: If its official travel, I prefer Vistara for its premium economy class. It has good leg room and seats are comfortable. I liked the on-flight food much. Customer service is also good.

After hearing so much about new Tata-Singapore airline venture, i decided to fly the new Vistara to Goa. After my first flight, i must say, they have won me over with their no-nonsense and efficient customer service approach.

Booking was done through a travel aggregator portal. On-line check-in was seamless. if you are an iPhone user, you get a boarding pass option for the wallet on your phone (I don't know if any other Indian airline company has this option. It is so convenient and cost effective and saves paper)

Airport reps were of pleasing personality and efficient. baggage drop was quick. planing process was systematic and once in the plane, the crew were welcoming and helpful. Captain's welcome was warm with flight weather and ETA communicated to all flyers.

Food was a sandwich, cookie, mango beverage - decent at best. cannot complain. crew was quick to disburse snacks and clearance as well.

Seat was comfortable. legroom was just right (i'm 6 feet tall). The magazine content was mediocre say when compared to Jet wings of Jet airways. I would like to see better content.

Overall, an excellent FULL-SERVICE airline. will definitely fly again.

Vistara being a JV between the Tata's and SIA, I had very high expectations.

But I was shocked to note the level of service before the flight.

First, my flight from Bombay to Goa was cancelled and they informed me only 2 days prior to ETD. The shocking bit was I had to make several calls to their customer service to convince them to put us on another airline on the same departure date, given that I had back to back hotel and flight bookings.

On my return from Goa, when we reached the airport, I was once again shocked to note that they had suspended our ticket! The reason being that the ticket was booked on an international credit card. We had to wait till their Delhi office could unblock the tickets after verifying my credit card!

That was not the end of our plight! The flight was delayed by an hour!

I have given Vistara 2 stars as the flying and in flight experience was great. Their level of pre flight services is horrible.

I will try never to fly Vistara again and would not recommend this airline to anyone. If you still want to fly Vistara, do so at your own risk.

column6: Eerily Familiar: In the Image of Indian Airlines
column7:
It was my first experience of Air Vistara and it began ominously. The security at the airport gate refused me entry saying my web-checkin pass did not carry my name! Well, after a visit to the counter I finally got in. I had to wait for over 10 minutes just for a baggage drop. The boarding took even longer with an additional elaborate security check by the airlines staff at the aircraft door.
I had taken care to book a seat in the economy first row. But i was in for a shock. Instead of having wider leg room, this row is more cramped as the premier class (something between business and economy) takes away extra space.
The announcements were with a strong accent making it largely incomprehensible. The refreshments were oh-so-familiar: dal and rice, dahi and a dessert. Since my journey had two sectors, the refreshment in the second sector had the same dessert, a lemon mousse/custard.
The only saving grace was that the flight was on time which means a lot. But it is also a little worrisome to note how much the airlines reminded one of the erstwhile Indian Airlines, the food, the announcements, even the interior decor. Finally, the stewardesses' attire could have been better designed: it resembles a pajama suit!
I booked on it only because it had the cheapest ticket going, but next time i have to think twice.
Being a new airline I would give them the benefit and expect them to improve over time.

column6: A review of flying the new feeling
column7:
I had originally booked myself on an evening flight on another airline but decided to take a morning #AirVistara flight instead. I took the decision one day prior to departure and found that the #AirVistara economy class pricing to be much lower than competition – about 15% lower approx. I made my booking on #Cleartrip of course – there is just no other site that is as well designed and intuitive. I put in my FF number on #Cleartrip while booking – usually the airline systems pick this up. The #AirVistara systems didn’t seem to, though.

Web-check in – I had to go to the #AirVistara site to do a seat assignment and check-in. The #AirVistara web-site is really slow and not built keeping the slowness of Indian internet in mind. Too many clunky images that take far too long to download. Once I was inside the web-checkin flow I felt that the flow was not intuitive. I had to first update the FF number – which is a separate funnel from the seat and meal selection. The seat selection is also not intuitive – there is a small box that logically looks like the place to click, but it is not. I was web checking-in about 14 hours prior and noticed that there were hardly any seats that were available – I counted less than a dozen. Is that because the airline system auto-allocates? I know from experience that so many people could not have checked in by themselves so much in advance. The exit row is not available for selection. This, for me, is a big negative as that is the seat that I select all the time and have no qualms about paying the extra charge for that comfort. After I finished checking-in I saw multiple options for delivery of the boarding pass (including an Apple Passbook feature) which I felt was well thought through. I couldn’t print the boarding pass as I didn’t have access to a printer and thought that I would do that at the airport kiosk.

Airport check-in – At the airport, I couldn’t see #AirVistara enabled in the kiosk. A big miss in my opinion, esp. if the core target audience is corporate & business travellers who have probably forgotten what it is like to stand in a check-in queue. At the check-in counter, I checked if the 11F that I had been allotted (thanks to someone in the #AirVistara team allotting this when we called them) was an exit row – and the agent was a bit confused, probably because of the LOPA changes currently underway (the airline is changing to a different seat configuration across their fleet). The service was, however, polite and courteous – definitely a few notches better that my recent experiences with other airlines.

Before the flight – The boarding process was smooth. Not sure if it was because there was no queue and I could walk straight through. The aircraft had a nice clean and fresh look to it and the welcome was warm and friendly. The exit row instructions were delivered personally rather than like a classroom that some airlines do these days. It was delivered well except that the attendant didn’t really make eye-contact all the time – doesn’t leave the right impression if the delivery is to be personal. Asked for some water before we took off and didn’t get it – maybe I was too close to push-back. Even if it was, would have been good to hear from the attendant that I would get it once we take off. I have never been a big fan of leather seats – feel that the leather makes the seat feel very hard, which is how the seats felt to me on the #AirVistara aircraft. The seats needed to be pushed very hard to get them to recline – not sure if that is the way they are designed or if it needs some looking into.

In the air – We pushed back ahead of time and were taxiing on the runway at the STD. That is something that one expects of a base departure anyways. There were only 7 exit row seats occupied which meant that I would have no one in the seat next to me – on a 2:30 long flight that was a luxury. This was in line with the occupancy in the Economy Cabin (I counted about 75 people) – which for a prime-time, week-day, inter-metro flight is a big commercial red flag. With extremely competitive pricing, why was it that #AirVistara was not able to fill the economy cabin? Is there a brand / marketing issue? Did they bank too much on last-minute demand that they forgot to get their share of the advance-booking travellers? Can’t really be an awareness issue as they have now been around for more than 15 months.

Food service – Carts were promptly rolled out as soon as we were airborne and I was served a veg breakfast as requested. My first impression was “Oh my god, the packaging is way too excessive”. Well designed for sure, but there must be other ways of delivering this that is far more ecologically responsible. The cutlery says “oxo-biodegradable pouch & cutlery – contributing to a sustainable planet’. Come on, we are just fooling ourselves if we seriously believe this. The poha and rava kesari/sheera for breakfast was really nice. A welcome change from the unexciting airline food that I have been having every week for the last several years.

The rest of the flight was quite uneventful as I decided to catch up on some sleep after I wrote this blog post. The landing was on time and quite smooth. There was an airport snafu when we got off the plane though – the gates to the terminal was shut and we had to wait for a few minutes before someone could open then.

Will I fly them again? I reckon so if their schedule is convenient for me – for which they will need to add more frequency on the routes that I usually fly every week.

column6: One of the best in flight services i have experienced in my more than 20 years of travelling
column7:
I was travelling alone, returning from a business trip. The ticket was booked by my wife and as this happened to be the only flight meeting my time requirements-It was going to be Vistara (a tie up of TATA and Singapore Airlines). I was expecting an uneventful flight and it was. The check-in staff were well spoken and well dressed as is the case with all airlines. (I might have generalized a bit about all airlines having well spoken staff.) Boarding was also carried out in sequential order of seating of course giving priority to women, children and elderly. Again now a days most airlines conduct their boarding in this manner so nothing new here. One thing which caught my attention was that in their announcements they referred to us (passengers) as "customers" which felt sort of depersonalized and distant. As I boarded the flight, it was obvious that they had acquired new planes-it felt clean and fresh. Found my seat and buckled up. After take off, they started the refreshment service. The food was good both in terms of quality and quantity. A lot of the passengers were fasting for navratra so they refused the food. The stewardesses could have cared less-they offered, the passengers refused-end of story. But this was not the case here. They kept asking them with a sound of genuine concern if they would like something else or if they would like to take something to eat later. This is what touched me most about this flight. Singapore airlines is known for their excellent service and hospitality and the staff at Vistara is doing a good job of upholding that tradition and this is why i believe it is one of the best domestic airlines I have flown till date. Their prices tend to be a bit on the pricier side and it would be nice if something could be done to make them more competetive so everyone would be able to get the Vistara experience and not just go for the other airline only because of the cheap air fare.
Its been more than a year since I have flown Vistara but my wife happened to travel with them recently and she assures me that they have maintained their hospitality even now.

Early bird, I know but with the times I have had to travel sitting in the middle seat!! This was bliss! As soon my luggage is checked in I am guided towards the gate. Midway, another friendly face. Vistara? I'm liking this!
Once inside the aircraft, the difference is obvious. Friendly smiling stewards. Not the plastic smiles that do not reach the eyes with the perfunctory reluctant greeting before you reach your seat. Everyone is courteous. A welcome drink of coconut water arrives soon after we are seated. And after that wet towels were distributed. This airline cares!
Mine was a 2-hour-ten-minute flight. Midway between the flight meals were served.I'm including a picture of my non-vegetarian meal of 'Kheema pav" along with one savoury accompaniment and dessert. The air steward was very attentive and it was over all a very good experience flying this airline. I'd surely opt for Vistara the next time I travel.
As we reached Guwahati, I left the aircraft feeling that this is the best airline in India!

column7: We were travelling to Lucknow and were carrying heavy luggage. Reached the airport very late due to a massive traffic jam at the Delhi Gurgaon border. Cabin has a fresh interior with all leather seats, adjustable Headrests, enough legroom even in the last row with reclining seats.

The pilot covered the distance in a short time and landed smooth, a very rare experience from a domestic flyer in India.

I look forward towards new flights and hope the feeling stays new forever.

Thank you team Vistara for this amazing experience.

column7: A trendy full service airline is how I would describe this airline. Being a Singapore Airlines joint venture with TATA, you could only expect a classy service and its bang on. Right from the way they treat customers to the actual experience of flying with them, the airline was by far a very good experience. The food, especially, was very good in quality and in line with what one would expect from airlines when flying in the 1980s-1990s. The general aura of the plane and the smartly dressed air hostesses can only be described as trendy. Leg room was adequate, seats were comfortable, air hostesses and staff were courteous, price was right for the service offered. There was no in-flight entertainment probably due to the short flight time (<1 hour).

Air Vistara is a true hallmark of the Tata and Singapore airlines brand. It has totally disrupted the Indian airline sector and offers extra value for money at competitive prices, good quality food, service and planes. I cannot comment on the timeliness of the airlines as the flights to and from Delhi are delayed in the winters due to heavy fog conditions. Also, the fact that it takes the international terminals in both Delhi and Mumbai, just add to the overall experience of the journey!
